cover.title: cover
cover.description: A section that introduces the work, often consisting of a marketing image, the title, author and publisher, and select quotes and reviews. ,

frontmatter.title: frontmatter
frontmatter.description: Preliminary material to the main content of a publication, such as tables of contents, dedications, etc. ,

bodymatter.title: bodymatter
bodymatter.description: The main content of a publication. ,

backmatter.title: backmatter
backmatter.description: Ancillary material occurring after the main content of a publication, such as indices, appendices, etc. ,

part.title: part
part.description: A major structural division in a work that contains a set of related sections dealing with a particular subject, narrative arc or similar encapsulated theme. ,

chapter.title: chapter
chapter.description: A major thematic section of content in a work. ,

subchapter.title: subchapter
subchapter.description: A major sub-division of a chapter. ,

division.title: division
division.description: A major structural division that may also appear as a substructure of a part (esp. in legislation). ,

sections.title: Document sections and components
sections.description: Sections and components that typically occur in the publication bodymatter.

abstract.title: abstract
abstract.description: A short summary of the principle ideas, concepts and conclusions of the work, or of a section or excerpt within it. ,

foreword.title: foreword
foreword.description: An introductory section that precedes the work, typically not written by the author of the work. ,

preface.title: preface
preface.description: An introductory section that precedes the work, typically written by the author of the work. ,

prologue.title: prologue
prologue.description: An introductory section that sets the background to a work, typically part of the narrative. ,

introduction.title: introduction
introduction.description: A preliminary section that typically introduces the scope or nature of the work. ,

preamble.title: preamble
preamble.description: A section in the beginning of the work, typically containing introductory and/or explanatory prose regarding the scope or nature of the work's content ,

conclusion.title: conclusion
conclusion.description: A concluding section or statement that summarizes the work or wraps up the narrative. ,

epilogue.title: epilogue
epilogue.description: A concluding section of narrative that wraps up or comments on the actions and events of the work, typically from a future perspective. ,

afterword.title: afterword
afterword.description: A closing statement from the author or a person of importance, typically providing insight into how the content came to be written, its significance, or related events that have transpired since its timeline. ,

epigraph.title: epigraph
epigraph.description: A quotation set at the start of the work or a section that establishes the theme or sets the mood. ,

toc.title: toc
toc.description: A navigational aid that provides an ordered list of links to the major sectional headings in the content. A table of contents may cover an entire work, or only a smaller section of it.

toc-brief.title: toc-brief
toc-brief.description: An abridged version of the table of contents.

landmarks.title: landmarks
landmarks.description: A collection of references to well-known/recurring components within the publication

loa.title: loa
loa.description: A listing of audio clips included in the work.

loi.title: loi
loi.description: A listing of illustrations included in the work.

lot.title: lot
lot.description: A listing of tables included in the work.

lov.title: lov
lov.description: A listing of video clips included in the work.

appendix.title: appendix
appendix.description: A section of supplemental information located after the primary content that informs the content but is not central to it.

colophon.title: colophon
colophon.description: A short section of production notes particular to the edition (e.g., describing the typeface used), often located at the end of a work. ,

preliminary.title: Preliminary sections and components
preliminary.description: Preliminary sections and components, typically occuring in the publication frontmatter.

titlepage.title: titlepage
titlepage.description: The title page of the work. ,

halftitlepage.title: halftitlepage
halftitlepage.description: The half title page of the work. ,

copyright-page.title: copyright-page
copyright-page.description: The copyright page of the work. ,

seriespage.title: seriespage
seriespage.description: Marketing section used to list related publications. ,

acknowledgments.title: acknowledgments
acknowledgments.description: A section or statement that acknowledges significant contributions by persons, organizations, governments and other entities to the realization of the work. ,

imprint.title: imprint
imprint.description: Information relating to the publication or distribution of the work. ,

imprimatur.title: imprimatur
imprimatur.description: A formal statement authorizing the publication of the work. ,

contributors.title: contributors
contributors.description: A list of contributors to the work. ,

other-credits.title: other-credits
other-credits.description: Acknowledgments of previously published parts of the work, illustration credits, and permission to quote from copyrighted material. ,

errata.title: errata
errata.description: A set of corrections discovered after initial publication of the work, sometimes referred to as corrigenda. , ,

dedication.title: dedication
dedication.description: An inscription at the front of the work, typically addressed in tribute to one or more persons close to the author. ,

revision-history.title: revision-history
revision-history.description: A record of changes made to a work. ,

aside.title: aside
aside.description: Secondary or supplementary content. Not Allowed Identifies a or as an escapable or skippable aside.

halftitle.title: halftitle
halftitle.description: The title appearing on the first page of a work or immediately before the text. . This property should only appear once within the document scope.

fulltitle.title: fulltitle
fulltitle.description: The full title of the work, either simple, in which case it is identical to , or compound, in which case it consists of a and a . . This property should only appear once within the document scope.

covertitle.title: covertitle
covertitle.description: The title of the work as displayed on the work's cover. . This property should only appear once within the document scope.

title.title: title
title.description: The primary name of a document component, such as a list, table or figure. , descendants of .

subtitle.title: subtitle
subtitle.description: An explanatory or alternate title for the work, or a section or component within it. , descendants of , ,

label.title: label
label.description: The text label that precedes an in a component title (e.g., 'Chapter', 'Part', 'Figure', 'Table'). descendants of , and

ordinal.title: ordinal
ordinal.description: An ordinal specifier for a component in a sequence of components (e.g., '1', 'IV', 'B-1'). descendants of , and

bridgehead.title: bridgehead
bridgehead.description: A structurally insignificant heading that does not contribute to the hierarchical structure of the work. , typically , or

balloon.title: balloon
balloon.description: An area in a comic that contains the words, spoken or thought, of a character.

text-area.title: text-area
text-area.description: An area of text in a comic . Used to represent titles, narrative text, character dialogue (inside a or not) and similar.

sound-area.title: sound-area
sound-area.description: An area of text in a comic that represents a sound.

annotation.title: annotation
annotation.description: Explanatory information about passages in the work. ,

note.title: note
note.description: A note. This property does not carry spatial positioning semantics, as do the and properties. It can be used to identify footnotes, endnotes, marginal notes, inline notes, and similar when legacy naming conventions are not desired. On the element when identifying a single note, or on descendants of sectioning content when identifying individual notes in a group (refer to and ).

footnote.title: footnote
footnote.description: Ancillary information, such as a citation or commentary, that provides additional context to a referenced passage of text. On the element when identifying a single footnote, or on descendants of sectioning content when identifying individual footnotes in a group (refer to and ).

endnote.title: endnote
endnote.description: One of a collection of notes that occur at the end of a work, or a section within it, that provides additional context to a referenced passage of text. On the element when identifying a single endnote, or on descendants of sectioning content when identifying individual endnotes in a group (refer to and ).

rearnote.title: rearnote
rearnote.description: A note appearing in the rear (backmatter) of the work, or at the end of a section. On the element when identifying a single rearnote, or on descendants of sectioning content when identifying individual rearnotes in a group (refer to and ).

endnotes.title: endnotes
endnotes.description: A collection of notes at the end of a work or a section within it.

rearnotes.title: rearnotes
rearnotes.description: A collection of notes appearing at the rear (backmatter) of the work, or at the end of a section.

noteref.title: noteref
noteref.description: A reference to a note, typically appearing as a superscripted number or symbol in the main body of text.

backlink.title: backlink
backlink.description: A link that allows the user to return to a related location in the content (e.g., from a to its reference or from a to where a is used).

document-text.title: Document text
document-text.description: Terms for describing components at the phrasing level.

credit.title: credit
credit.description: An acknowledgment of the source of integrated content from third-party sources, such as photos. Typically identifies the creator, copyright and any restrictions on reuse.

topic-sentence.title: topic-sentence
topic-sentence.description: A phrase or sentence serving as an introductory summary of the containing paragraph.

concluding-sentence.title: concluding-sentence
concluding-sentence.description: A phrase or sentence serving as a concluding summary of the containing paragraph.

pagebreak.title: pagebreak
pagebreak.description: A separator denoting the position before which a break occurs between two contiguous pages in a statically paginated version of the content. and content, where the value of the carrying elements title attribute takes precedence over element content for the purposes of representing the pagebreak value

page-list.title: page-list
page-list.description: A navigational aid that provides a list of links to the in the content.

table.title: table
table.description: A structure containing data or content laid out in tabular form. Not Allowed Identifies a or as an escapable or skippable table structure.

table-row.title: table-row
table-row.description: A row of data or content in a tabular structure. Not Allowed Identifies a or as an escapable or skippable table row.

table-cell.title: table-cell
table-cell.description: A single cell of tabular data or content. Not Allowed Identifies a or as an escapable or skippable table cell.

list.title: list
list.description: A structure that contains an enumeration of related content items. Not Allowed Identifies a or as an escapable or skippable list structure.

list-item.title: list-item
list-item.description: A single item in an enumeration. Not Allowed Identifies a or as an escapable or skippable list item.

figure.title: figure
figure.description: An illustration, diagram, photo, code listing or similar, referenced from the text of a work, and typically annotated with a title, caption and/or credits. Not Allowed Identifies a or as an escapable or skippable figure.
